It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Oxymitra bakeri is considered a threatened species in its native range.
